Entities.Actors

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Entities.Entity
      • Entities.Actors.Actor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Enemy, GuildHead, Player

    public abstract class Actor
extends Entity
    Created by Parzival on 4/20/2016.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getHealth() 
      float getSpeed() 
      float getxMove() 
      float getyMove() 
      void move()
      this is the base for movement where it will check that there is nothing hindering the Actor in the space they are trying to move to
      void moveX()
      This is for movement based along the X axis This is how the player moves, it look to see if the collision is false in both top and bottom of the entities bounding box and will either render it at the original space or move it accordingly
      void moveY()
      This is the movement based on the Y axis This is how the player moves, it look to see if the collision is false in both top and bottom of the entities bounding box and will either render it at the original space or move it accordingly
      void setHealth(int health) 
      void setSpeed(int speed) 
      void setxMove(int xMove) 
      void setyMove(int yMove)

      • Actor

        public Actor(Handler hands,
             float x,
             float y,
             int width,
             int height)
        the constructor for the Actor class which the player is based off of
        Parameters:
        hands - the handler var
        x - the position in terms of x
        y - the position in terms of y
        width - the width of the actor
        height - the height of the actor

        public void move()
        this is the base for movement where it will check that there is nothing hindering the Actor in the space they are trying to move to

      • moveX

        public void moveX()
        This is for movement based along the X axis This is how the player moves, it look to see if the collision is false in both top and bottom of the entities bounding box and will either render it at the original space or move it accordingly

      • moveY

        public void moveY()
        This is the movement based on the Y axis This is how the player moves, it look to see if the collision is false in both top and bottom of the entities bounding box and will either render it at the original space or move it accordingly
